Module Basics
Package basics.math.rot

Class RotoTranslation2D

java.lang.Object
basics.math.rot.RotoTranslation2D
public class RotoTranslation2D
extends java.lang.Object
An object that encapsulates a rotation and translation in two dimensions.
  • first apply rotation in the x-y-plane
  • then apply translation among x, y
Note in contrast to RotoTranslation there exist only one implementation (based on matrixes) as quaternions are not useful for 2D rotations.
Author:
Jörg Roth (Joerg.Roth@Wireless-earth.org)

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    RotoTranslation2D()
    Create a roto-translation without any effect, i.e. null rotation and null translation.

    Create a roto-translation.

    Create a roto-translation with null rotation and only translation.
    RotoTranslation2D​(double x, double y, double ang)
    Create a roto-translation.
    RotoTranslation2D​(RotoTranslation2D rotoTranslation)
    Copying constructor - all internal structures are deeply copied.
    RotoTranslation2D​(RotoTranslation2D rt1, RotoTranslation2D rt2)
    Create a total roto-translation of two separate roto-translations.

      Create a roto-translation without any effect, i.e. null rotation and null translation.

      Create a roto-translation.

      x - translation x
      y - translation y
      ang - angle in radians

    • RotoTranslation2D

      public RotoTranslation2D​(double[][] rotation, double[] translation)
      Create a roto-translation.
      Parameters:
      rotation - rotation matrix (2 x 2)
      translation - translation vector (2)

    • RotoTranslation2D

      public RotoTranslation2D​(RotoTranslation2D rotoTranslation)
      Copying constructor - all internal structures are deeply copied.
      Parameters:
      rotoTranslation - roto-translation to be copied

    • RotoTranslation2D

      public RotoTranslation2D​(RotoTranslation2D rt1, RotoTranslation2D rt2)
      Create a total roto-translation of two separate roto-translations.
      Parameters:
      rt1 - first roto-translation to be applied
      rt2 - second roto-translation to be applied

  • Method Details

    • inverse

      public RotoTranslation2D inverse()
      Creates a roto-translation that represents the inverse mapping. This means, after 
       double[] y=rt.rotoTranslate(x);
 double[] x2=rt.inverse().rotoTranslate(y);
      x and y are practically equal.
      Returns:
      the inverse

    • rotoTranslate

      public double[] rotoTranslate​(double[] point)
      Roto-translate a point.
      Parameters:
      point - point
      Returns:
      roto-translated point

    • rotoTranslateInverse

      public double[] rotoTranslateInverse​(double[] point)
      Roto-translate a point with inverse function. This means, after 
       double[] x=...
 double[] y=rt.rotoTranslateInverse(rt.rotoTranslate(x));
      x and y are practically equal.
      Parameters:
      point - point
      Returns:
      inverse roto-translated point

    • rotoTranslateInverse

      public double[] rotoTranslateInverse​(double x, double y)
      Roto-translate a point with inverse function.
      Parameters:
      x - point x
      y - point y
      Returns:
      inverse roto-translated point

    • rotateInverse

      public double[] rotateInverse​(double[] point)
      Rotate a point with inverse function (i.e. only apply inverse rotation, ignore translation). This means, after 
       double[] x=...
 double[] y=rt.rotateInverse(rt.rotate(x));
      x and y are practically equal.
      Parameters:
      point - point
      Returns:
      inverse rotated point

    • rotateInverse

      public double[] rotateInverse​(double x, double y)
      Rotate a point with inverse function (i.e. only apply inverse rotation, ignore translation).
      Parameters:
      x - point x
      y - point y
      Returns:
      inverse rotated point
